answers.answer: One-sided headaches are typical of migraines, cluster headaches, and hemicranias.  Pins and needles in your hands could be caused by a minor stoke, as well.  Feeling "tired" is common after any of these types of headaches.See your doctor, and get an MRI if at all possible.  If this continues, you probably need a full blood-and-urine workup.Running to the toilet alot could be a symptom of Diabetes Insepidus (rare), in which case drinking alot of water would lessen the headache pain.  Your symptoms could also be caused by heavy alcohol use - so if that's the case then you should be honest with your doctor about it.

question: I have a headache in the right side of my head with pins and needles in my right hand.  Also running to the tiolet a lot this morning and feeling tired.
title: Whats the problem can you give me answer
